title: Westfield Memorial Library  resumes curbside service
body: The Westfield Memorial Library has resumed curbside service for Westfield patrons. As a result, patrons can no longer borrow from the four area libraries that helped Westfield when the library was closed.“The Westfield Memorial Library is incredibly grateful to the Clark, Cranford, Mountainside and Scotch Plains Libraries for their help in providing services to Westfield residents while the library was closed,” said director Phil Israel. “They changed their policies and protocols to permit our patrons to borrow their materials. However, we do not want to overstay our welcome, so please return materials to the originating libraries when you have finished with them.”Beginning March 29, Westfield residents will be able to reserve materials. Patrons can pick up reserved materials curbside Monday through Thursday 9:30 a.m. to 6:30 p.m.; Friday and Saturday 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; and Sunday 1 to 4:30 p.m.Westfield patrons can still access the library’s digital services and online programs by visiting the library’s website at  or the library’s facebook page. The library has also added additional programs to its You Tube channel, which can be found at , or by clicking on the You Tube icon on the library’s website.Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
